intro: Stapfiola bipinnata, commonly known as the two-pinnate stapfiola, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that come in a variety of colors. The plant has opposite, ovate leaves with a slightly hairy surface, and it produces small, clustered inflorescences. Stapfiola bipinnata is often cultivated as a decorative plant due to its ornamental value and ease of care. It thrives in well-drained soil and prefers bright, indirect light.
